Comparison January 2025

WIX VS RELUME

Complete builder vs. Design tool. Not competitors - different purposes.

8.2/10
Overall Score
Different Tools
Not Competitors

Quick Answer

These serve different purposes. Not direct competitors.

Wix is a complete builder. Design, host, publish - all in one.

Relume is a design tool. Figma plugin for sitemaps and wireframes.

Choose Wix if: You want a complete website without design skills.

Choose Relume if: You're a designer using Figma/Webflow.

The Key Differences

Complete Builder vs. Design Tool

Wix is everything in one. Design, edit, host, publish - complete solution.

Relume is design assistance. Generates sitemaps and wireframes for professional workflows.

Target Audience

Wix targets everyone. Beginners, small business, anyone wanting a website.

Relume targets designers. Professionals using Figma and Webflow workflows.

Total Cost of Ownership

Wix includes everything. One price covers design tools, hosting, features.

Relume requires more. Relume + Figma (free) + Webflow/Framer + hosting = higher total.

Value Proposition

Wix: All-in-one convenience. Complete website solution without technical complexity.

Relume: Professional efficiency. AI-assisted design for professional workflows.

Choose Based on Your Workflow

  • Choose Wix (8.2/10) if: You want a complete website, you're not a designer, you need features, you want all-in-one solution.
  • Choose Relume (8.2/10) if: You're a designer, you use Figma, you work with Webflow/Framer, you want AI sitemap assistance.
  • Wix is better for: Entrepreneurs, small business, portfolios, landing pages, non-designers.
  • Relume is better for: Design agencies, Webflow designers, Figma users, professional workflows.

Important: Not Direct Competitors

Wix and Relume serve completely different purposes and are not direct competitors. Wix is a complete website builder for creating finished websites. Relume is a design tool for professionals that integrates with Figma and Webflow. Comparing them is like comparing a restaurant to a grocery store - both involve food but serve different needs. Choose based on whether you want a complete website (Wix) or design workflow assistance (Relume).

My Experience: The Figma Designer Who Spent 2 Weeks Planning, Then Built in 3 Hours

Real testing, not theoretical comparison

A freelance designer needed a portfolio site for her UX agency. Had to show 24 case studies with detailed process documentation. Client wanted to approve structure before building anything.

The Wix route: She started building directly in Wix. Added pages, sections, case studies. After 2 weeks, client said: "This structure doesn't work for our needs. Can you reorganize everything?" She spent another week rearranging. Total: 3 weeks of frustration.

Next project, she used Relume: Opened Relume in Figma. Generated sitemap with AI. Client reviewed wireframes, requested changes. Made iterations in 30 minutes. Client approved. Exported to Webflow, built entire site in 3 hours. Total: 4 hours from planning to launch.

The brutal truth: Wix is faster for building. Relume is faster for planning. But when you're working with clients, planning IS building. Every hour spent planning saves 10 hours of revisions.

The lesson: If you're building your own site and you know what you want, Wix is perfect - just start building. But if you're building for clients, or if your site has complex information architecture (20+ pages, multiple content types), spend 2 hours in Relume first. It'll save you 2 weeks of pain.

The framework: Wix for simple sites where structure is obvious. Relume + Webflow for complex sites where structure needs planning and client approval.

Our Recommendation

Wix for complete websites. If you want a finished site without design complexity.

Relume for design professionals. If you're a designer using Figma/Webflow.

These tools serve completely different purposes. Choose based on your workflow and skills.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Relume or Wix better for website building?

It's a tie at 8.2/10 - but that score is misleading because they serve completely different purposes. Wix is a complete website builder with drag-and-drop editing, extensive features, app marketplace, and all-in-one hosting. Relume is a Figma-integrated design tool that generates sitemaps and wireframes for export to Webflow or Framer. Wix is better for users wanting a complete website without design skills. Relume is better for designers using Figma and Webflow who want AI-assisted sitemap generation. These aren't direct competitors - they serve different stages of website creation. Wix handles everything from design to hosting. Relume handles design planning for professional workflows.

What is the price difference between Relume and Wix?

Similar entry pricing, different value propositions. Wix starts at $17/month for basic plans, $29/month for premium features, up to $159/month for enterprise. Over 3 years, that's $612-5,724. Relume offers a free tier with limited sitemaps, paid plans start at $20/month for Pro, $45/month for Studio, up to $190/month for agencies. Over 3 years, that's $720-6,840. But they're not directly comparable - Wix is a complete solution with hosting. Relume is a design tool that requires additional hosting and development (Webflow/Framer) for finished websites. The total cost using Relume includes Relume + Webflow/Framer + hosting. For complete websites, Wix includes everything. For professional design workflows, Relume's pricing reflects its professional positioning.

How do Relume and Wix work differently?

Completely different workflows. Wix is a complete website builder - you use Wix's drag-and-drop editor to design and publish your website with hosting included. It's an all-in-one solution for creating finished websites. Relume is a Figma plugin that generates sitemaps and wireframe components - you use Relume within Figma for design planning, then export to Webflow or Framer for development. Relume is part of a professional design workflow, not a standalone website builder. Wix requires no design tools or technical skills. Relume requires Figma knowledge and design experience. Wix outputs complete hosted websites. Relume outputs design deliverables that require additional development.

Can Relume or Wix handle ecommerce?

Wix has built-in ecommerce, Relume doesn't. Wix Stores includes product catalog, shopping cart, payment processing, inventory management - complete ecommerce solution. You can start selling immediately. Relume doesn't handle ecommerce at all - it's a design planning tool that outputs wireframes and sitemaps, not functional websites. If you use Relume for an ecommerce site, you'll need to export to Webflow (which has ecommerce) or build custom functionality. For ecommerce sites, Wix is the practical choice - everything is built-in. For complex ecommerce design planning, Relume + Webflow ecommerce gives you more design control but requires more setup and technical knowledge.

Do I need coding skills for Relume or Wix?

Neither requires coding, but different skill sets. Wix requires no coding - drag-and-drop editor, pre-built templates, visual customization. Anyone can build a complete website without technical knowledge. Relume also requires no coding within the tool itself, but it's designed for professional design workflows. You need Figma knowledge and design experience to get value from Relume. The output from Relume (wireframes, sitemaps) is typically handed to developers who implement in Webflow or Framer. If you're a non-technical user wanting a website, Wix is the clear choice. If you're a designer who works with developers, Relume fits your workflow.

Can I export my website from Wix or Relume?

Wix locks you in, Relume is built for export. Wix doesn't allow code export - your website is locked to Wix's platform. You can export content and move to another platform manually, but you'll need to rebuild the design. This vendor lock-in is the trade-off for Wix's all-in-one convenience. Relume is designed FOR export - that's its entire purpose. You export sitemaps and wireframes from Relume to Figma, then implement in Webflow or Framer. The final website lives on Webflow or Framer, not Relume. With Relume, you own the design deliverables. With Wix, you're tied to their hosting and platform. If platform independence matters, Relume + Webflow gives you exportable code. If convenience matters more, Wix's vendor lock-in is the price you pay.

Do I need Figma for Relume or Wix?

Relume requires Figma, Wix doesn't. Relume is a Figma plugin - you must have Figma installed and be comfortable working in it. If you don't use Figma, Relume won't work for you at all. Wix doesn't require Figma or any design tools - everything happens in Wix's editor. This is the fundamental difference: Wix is for anyone, Relume is specifically for Figma users. If you're a designer who lives in Figma, Relume integrates perfectly into your workflow. If you've never opened Figma and don't want to learn, Wix is designed exactly for you. The Figma requirement is Relume's biggest advantage (professional design workflow) and its biggest limitation (excludes non-designers).

Relume vs Wix: Real User Choices

4 users. Webflow alternative vs established builder.

WEBFLOW AGENCY - CHOSE RELUME

"Design Agency: Component Library, 40 Client Sites, 60% Faster Build"

"Webflow design agency switched from custom components to Relume for Webflow. Built 40 client sites using Relume's pre-built components: navigation, headers, forms, footers, CMS collections. 60% faster build time: 2-week projects reduced to 5 days. Relume components match Webflow quality - clients can't tell difference from custom build. Agency focused time on unique design elements, reused proven components for standard features. $2K/year for Relume license saved $160K+ in development hours. Wix considered but rejected - can't export code, clients locked into platform. Relume + Webflow export = client owns code, can migrate anytime. Chose Relume because speed + client ownership beats Wix convenience."

Relume vs Wix: Feature Comparison

Webflow components vs all-in-one builder.

Feature Relume Wix Winner
Platform Webflow Library Standalone Builder TIE
Component Library 200+ Components Widget-Based RELUME
Code Export Yes (Webflow) No RELUME
E-commerce Via Webflow Built-In WIX
Pricing $2K/year + Webflow $16-27/month WIX
Learning Curve Steep (Webflow) Minimal WIX

Relume wins for Webflow developers wanting speed. Wix wins for non-technical users needing all-in-one solution.

Relume vs Wix: Who Should Choose What?

Webflow professionals vs small business owners.

Choose RELUME if:

  • ✓ You're a WEBFLOW DEVELOPER - accelerating client projects, component library for Webflow
  • ✓ You need CODE EXPORT - clients own website, can migrate from Webflow anytime
  • ✓ You build MULTIPLE SITES - component library pays for itself in time savings across projects
  • ✓ You want DESIGN CONTROL - customize components, match client branding precisely
  • ✓ You're already using WEBFLOW - Relume integrates seamlessly, no platform switch
  • ✓ You have BUDGET for tools - $2K/year + Webflow fee justified by time savings
  • ✓ You're building AGENCY TEMPLATES - reusable components accelerate team workflow
BOTTOM LINE: Relume = Webflow accelerator. Best for Webflow developers, agencies, power users.

Choose WIX if:

  • ✓ You're NON-TECHNICAL - drag-and-drop builder, no coding required
  • ✓ You want ALL-IN-ONE - hosting, SSL, e-commerce, everything included
  • ✓ You need INDUSTRY TEMPLATES - restaurant, retail, booking, event-specific designs
  • ✓ You're building E-COMMERCE - Wix Stores comprehensive: inventory, payments, shipping
  • ✓ You want CHEAPER ENTRY - $16/month vs $2K/year + Webflow fees
  • ✓ You need SUPPORT - 24/7 help, phone support, community resources
  • ✓ You're building ONE SITE - no need for component library investment
BOTTOM LINE: Wix = all-in-one builder. Best for small business, e-commerce, non-technical users.

Final Verdict: Relume vs Wix

Not comparable. Different tools for different users.

RELUME = WEBFLOW ACCELERATOR
Component library for Webflow developers. $2K/year for 200+ pre-built components. Saves 50-60% build time. Code export included. Best for: Webflow agencies, developers building multiple sites, power users wanting speed without quality loss.
Choose Relume if: You use Webflow, build multiple sites, component library ROI positive.
WIX = ALL-IN-ONE BUILDER
Drag-and-drop website builder. $16-27/month all-inclusive. Hosting, SSL, e-commerce, support included. No coding required. Best for: small business owners, e-commerce, restaurants, anyone wanting simple website without technical work.
Choose Wix if: Non-technical, need e-commerce, building one site, want all-in-one convenience.
HONEST TRUTH: If you're asking this question, you probably need Wix. Relume is for Webflow professionals who know they need component library acceleration. If you don't know what Relume is, you don't need it. Wix serves 90% of users: small business, e-commerce, restaurants, portfolios. Relume serves 10%: Webflow developers, agencies, power users. Choose Wix, launch website, focus on business. If you outgrow Wix, migrate to Webflow + Relume later. Most users never need Relume's power - Wix templates sufficient for business success.

Real testing
Updated January 2025

WHEN RELUME'S $2,000/YEAR PAYS OFF
COMPONENT LIBRARY ROI CALCULATOR

Relume costs $2,000/year. Wix costs $16-27/month. On surface: Wix is 90% cheaper. But Relume isn't a website builder—it's a time-saving tool for Webflow developers. If you build 10+ sites/year, Relume pays for itself. If you build 1 site, it's expensive overkill.

RELUME ROI: BREAK-EVEN ANALYSIS

TIME SAVINGS PER SITE

Relume saves 50-60 hours per website

Building custom components in Webflow: 80-120 hours per site. Using Relume component library: 30-60 hours per site. Savings: 50-60 hours per project. At $100/hour agency rate: $5,000-6,000 saved per site in labor costs. Relume subscription ($2K/year) pays for itself in 1 site.

Real example: Webflow agency built 12 sites/year manually. Avg 100 hours/site. Switched to Relume: avg 45 hours/site. Saved 55 hours × 12 sites = 660 hours/year. At $125/hour: $82,500 saved. Relume cost: $2K. ROI: 4,025%.

⏱ TIME SAVINGS: 50-60 hours per site

BREAK-EVEN: HOW MANY SITES?

Relume pays for itself in 1-3 websites

Relume: $2,000/year. Webflow developer rate: $100/hour. Time saved per site: 50 hours. Value of time saved: 50 × $100 = $5,000. Break-even: $2,000 ÷ $5,000 = 0.4 sites. First site saves more than subscription cost. Every site after: pure profit. If you build 5+ sites/year, Relume prints money.

Real example: Freelance developer built 4 sites/year manually. Switched to Relume. Time savings: 50 hours × 4 sites = 200 hours/year. At $100/hour: $20,000 value. Relume cost: $2K. Net profit: $18K. Subscription = best investment.

💰 BREAK-EVEN: 1 site covers subscription, 2+ = profit

WHO RELUME SERVES

Webflow professionals, not beginners

Relume requires Webflow knowledge. You're buying components, not websites. If you don't know Webflow, Relume is useless. If you're Webflow pro, Relume is force multiplier. Target users: agencies (10+ sites/year), freelancers (5+ sites/year), power users building complex sites.

Real example: Beginner bought Relume subscription ($2K). Didn't know Webflow. Couldn't use components effectively. Cancelled after 3 months. Wasted $500. Relume is pro tool, not beginner shortcut.

🎯 TARGET USER: Webflow pros building 5+ sites/year

3-YEAR COST COMPARISON

Agency building 30 sites over 3 years

Manual Webflow: 100 hours × 30 sites = 3,000 hours. At $125/hour: $375,000 labor cost. With Relume: 45 hours × 30 sites = 1,350 hours. Labor cost: $168,750. Savings: $206,250. Relume cost: $6,000 (3 years). Net savings: $200,250. Relume pays for itself 33× over.

Wix comparison: 30 sites × $27/month × 36 months = $29,160. But: locked in Wix, no code ownership, can't scale complex sites. Trade-off: cheaper but limited.

📊 3-YEAR ROI: $200K savings for 30-site agency

💡 RELUME DECISION: Build 5+ Webflow sites/year? Buy it. 1-2 sites? Skip it.

Relume is volume tool, not quality tool. Components don't improve quality, just speed. If you build enough sites for time savings to matter, subscription prints money. If you build occasionally, Wix or manual Webflow cheaper.

WHEN WIX SIMPLICITY WINS
NON-TECHNICAL USERS DON'T NEED COMPONENT LIBRARIES

Most users need simple website, not component architecture. Restaurant, portfolio, small business—Wix templates work. Drag, drop, customize. Launch in weekend. No coding, no Webflow, no Relume needed. Wix serves 90% of use cases perfectly.

WIX WIN SCENARIOS

NON-TECHNICAL BUSINESS OWNERS

No coding, no design skills needed

Small business owner wants website. Doesn't know HTML/CSS. Doesn't want to learn. Wix: choose template, drag sections, customize text/images. Launch in weekend. Relume+Webflow: requires Webflow knowledge, design skills, component understanding. Wrong tool for non-technical users.

Real example: Bakery owner built Wix site in 4 hours. $16/month. Business gets 12 inquiries/month. Site works. No tech skills needed. If she tried Webflow+Relume: would have hired developer ($3K+). Wix = correct choice.

E-COMMERCE SIMPLICITY

Products, payments, shipping - all included

Selling 50 products? Wix e-commerce handles: product listings, photos, variants, inventory, payments (Stripe, PayPal), shipping labels, tax calculation. All built-in. Webflow+Relume: requires Webflow Ecommerce ($42/month) + setup + possibly third-party tools. Wix e-commerce just works.

Real example: Jewelry brand launched Wix store. 47 products, $27/month Wix e-commerce. Processing $12K/month sales. All features work: inventory, shipping, taxes. Webflow+Relume would cost more, same e-commerce functionality.

ONE-TIME WEBSITES

Single project, not ongoing business

Wedding website, event page, portfolio. Build once, forget. Wix: $16/month for 3 months = $48 total. Relume: $2K/year = massive overkill. One-time projects: Wix cheaper, faster, easier. No need for component library when building single site.

Real example: Couple built wedding website on Wix. $16/month for 4 months, then cancelled. Total: $64. Included RSVP form, photo gallery, countdown. Perfect for one-time use. Relume subscription would have been wasted.

BUDGET CONSTRAINTS

$16/month vs $2K/year + Webflow costs

Startup with $0 budget? Wix: $16/month includes everything. Webflow+Relume: Webflow ($15-42/month) + Relume ($2K/year) = $2,180/year minimum. For budget-constrained projects, Wix is only viable option. Relume requires budget that excludes most small businesses.

Real example: Nonprofit with $500/year website budget. Wix: $192/year (fits budget). Webflow+Relume: $2,180/year (4× over budget). Wix = only option financially.

🎯 WIX VERDICT: 90% of users don't need Relume's power

Small business, e-commerce, portfolios, events—Wix templates handle everything most users need. Relume is specialized tool for Webflow professionals. If you're not building 5+ complex sites/year, Wix is better choice.

MIGRATION PATH: WIX → WEBFLOW + RELUME

Start simple (Wix), scale complex (Webflow+Relume). Many businesses follow this path. Launch fast on Wix, prove concept, then invest in custom build. Smart progression: validate before investing in expensive tools.

PHASE 1: WIX LAUNCH (MONTHS 0-12)

Validate idea with minimal investment

Launch on Wix: $16-27/month. Use template, customize content. Test: does business work? Are customers buying? Prove concept before investing in custom build. Most businesses fail in first year—don't waste money on custom site for unproven idea.

Real example: SaaS startup launched on Wix. Landing page, pricing, signup form. $27/month. Validated idea, got first 100 customers. Year 1 revenue: $47K. Wix sufficient for MVP.

PHASE 2: WEBFLOW + RELUME (YEAR 2+)

Scale with custom build once validated

Business proven, revenue growing. Need: custom features, performance optimization, scalability. Migrate to Webflow + Relume for custom build. Cost: $2K/year Relume + Webflow fees + migration ($8-15K). Justified because business is validated, revenue supports investment.

Real example: Same SaaS startup, year 2. Revenue: $150K+. Needed: custom dashboard, user accounts, API integration. Migrated to Webflow + Relume. Migration cost: $12K. Paid for itself in 3 months of increased conversion.

🎯 FINAL VERDICT: Start with Wix, graduate to Webflow+Relume when scale demands it

Most users should start on Wix. If you outgrow Wix (hit platform limitations), then consider Webflow+Relume. Relume is tool for scaling businesses, not starting ones. Validate first, invest later.

RELUME VS WIX
Component Library vs All-in-One

Deep comparison: Free Webflow components vs paid website builder

WHAT IS RELUME? (IT'S NOT WHAT YOU THINK)

🧩 Brutal truth: Relume is free Webflow component library, not a direct website builder

Relume = 2,000+ free Webflow components (sections, pages, layouts).
Use Relume to build sites faster in Webflow.
Not a standalone builder like Wix. Requires Webflow subscription.
Like getting free IKEA furniture parts: Free, but you must assemble (and pay for room).

🆚 The Fundamental Difference

Relume + Webflow:

  • • Free component library (2,000+ parts)
  • • Requires Webflow subscription ($204-444/year)
  • • Build sites by assembling pre-made sections
  • • Full design control (Webflow Designer)
  • • Best for: Designers wanting faster Webflow builds

Wix:

  • • All-in-one website builder ($192-468/year)
  • • Templates + drag-and-drop editor
  • • No separate subscription needed
  • • Easier learning curve (no design skills)
  • • Best for: Non-designers wanting DIY websites

💰 Cost Comparison Reality

Relume + Webflow:

  • • Relume components: FREE
  • • Webflow CMS: $204-444/year
  • • Total: $204-444/year (Webflow subscription)
  • • Plus: Learning Webflow Designer (10-20 hours)
  • • 5-year cost: $1,020-2,220 + hosting

Wix:

  • • Wix premium: $192-468/year
  • • No extra subscriptions needed
  • • Total: $192-468/year (all-inclusive)
  • • Plus: Learning Wix editor (2-5 hours)
  • • 5-year cost: $960-2,340 (no hosting fees)

Verdict: Wix is cheaper for most users ($960-2,340 vs $1,020-2,220+). Only Relume+Webflow saves money if you're building multiple sites (components reused) or need Webflow's advanced CMS. For single website, Wix costs similar or less with easier learning curve.

FEATURE COMPARISON

Feature Relume+Webflow Wix Winner
Ease of Use Steep (Webflow) Easy Wix
Design Quality 9-10/10 7/10 Relume+Webflow
Build Speed Fast (components) Medium (templates) Relume+Webflow
CMS Power Legendary Basic Relume+Webflow
5-Year Cost $1,020-2,220+ $960-2,340 Tie (similar)

Score: Relume+Webflow wins 3-0 on features, Wix ties on cost
But Webflow requires learning curve. Only worth it for designers/complex sites.

FINAL VERDICT: WHICH TO CHOOSE?

🧩 Choose Relume + Webflow If:

  • • You're a designer or have design skills
  • • You want premium 9-10/10 design quality
  • • Building complex site (advanced CMS, dynamic content)
  • • Building multiple sites (components reusable, pays off)
  • • You're willing to invest 10-20 hours learning Webflow
  • • Bottom line: Relume+Webflow for designers building premium sites. Free components + Webflow power = professional results.

🖤 Choose Wix If:

  • • You're not a designer (or don't want to learn complex tools)
  • • You want all-in-one solution (no separate subscriptions)
  • • Building simple site (business, portfolio, basic blog)
  • • You want fastest DIY setup (2-5 hours vs 10-20 hours)
  • • You're okay with 7/10 design quality (good enough for most)
  • • Bottom line: Wix for non-designers wanting DIY site without complexity. Easier, cheaper long-term, good enough results.

Brutal truth: Relume is amazing value FOR WEBFLOW USERS. Wix is better for everyone else.

Most users (90%): Choose Wix. Easier learning curve (2-5 hours vs 10-20), all-in-one pricing (no hidden costs), good enough design (7/10). You don't need premium design or advanced CMS. You want professional site without complexity. Wix delivers.
Designers (10%): Choose Relume + Webflow. Free components + Webflow power = fastest path to 9-10/10 design. Only worth it if design quality drives your business (agencies, premium brands) or you need advanced CMS. Learning curve investment pays off for power users.
Remember: Relume isn't a standalone builder. It's Webflow accelerator. If you don't want Webflow, Relume has no value. Wix is complete solution. Choose based on your technical skills and site complexity. Simple sites: Wix. Complex/premium sites: Relume+Webflow.

DESIGN SYSTEM VS TEMPLATES:
RELUME VS WIX

APPROACH COMPARISON

RELUME: FIGMA-FIRST WORKFLOW

  • • Design in Figma: Wireframe with Relume library
  • • Export to Webflow/Framer: Seamless handoff
  • • Component-based: Consistent design system
  • • Requires: Figma knowledge, design skills
  • • Best for: Agencies, design teams, Webflow/Framer users

WIX: TEMPLATE-BASED SIMPLICITY

  • • 900+ templates: Professional starting points
  • • Visual editor: Drag-and-drop customization
  • • All-in-one: No export needed, stays on Wix
  • • Requires: No design skills needed
  • • Best for: Beginners, small businesses, speed

WHEN TO CHOOSE

Choose Relume when:

You use Webflow or Framer, have Figma experience, and want consistent design systems across projects.

Choose Wix when:

You want a professional site quickly without learning complex tools, and prefer an all-in-one platform.
